metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15010 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A ReDoS (regular expression denial of service) flaw was found in thetough-cookie module before 2.3.3 for Node.js. An attacker that is able tomake an HTTP request using a specially crafted cookie may cause theapplication to consume an excessive amount of CPU.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-tough-cookie - 2.3.4+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: node-tough-cookie package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.4+dfsg-1').
